primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters a dark, hostile world through Jesus to fulfill the role of the 'True Son' who obeys where humanity fails, thereby securing salvation for the weak.

tekstueel_bewijs: He was the only person who ever actually obeyed the Father.
He was the only true Son, Israelite, and human being.
He’s the true altar and the true sacrifice.

object.identificatie: The Blessing of God/Salvation for the weak
tekstueel_bewijs: He got the curse for our disobedience, so if we believe in him we get the blessing for his obedience.

zender.identificatie: God the Father (as the one who fulfills prophecy and demands obedience)
tekstueel_bewijs: God is serving notice: 'I don’t do things the way the world thinks they should be done.'
God says to the human race, 'Obey me... and I will bless you.'

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Weak' / Humanity (those who realize they cannot save themselves)
tekstueel_bewijs: I only save those who know they’re weak.
The girl nobody wanted is the one he chooses.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied via the 'melting' of the heart) and the Word (Prophecy)
tekstueel_bewijs: You can melt your heart with the knowledge of what he did.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Little Herod' in the human heart / Cosmic Authority Problem
tekstueel_bewijs: Every one of us has a little Herod in our hearts.
The natural heart is enmity toward God.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a historical tyrant (Herod) but an ontological condition of the human heart (enmity) that prevents obedience.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian life as a 'fight' to keep Jesus at the center and overcome residual hostility.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Making Jesus Lord / Prayer and Obedience
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/sanctification) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (grace/soteriology). The heart is 'melted' first so it can then 'fight'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/Blessing → The Weak

voorbeelden_god_subject: He got the curse for our disobedience.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You want to choose for yourself.
We have a cosmic authority problem.
You’re never going to be any kind of Christian unless you’re willing to fight.

voorbeelden: Unless you deny yourself... you cannot be my disciple.
I want atheism to be true.
You don’t want other people telling you how to live.
Matthew can look at this passage... and see it's all about Jesus.
He only save those who know they’re weak.
You can’t just coerce your heart... you can melt your heart.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of 'Pouvoir' (ability to obey) and God's provision of it through the 'Pouvoir' of Christ's finished work.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Herod's darkness) to ~S1 (the 98% who think they are good) to S1 (Christ as the True Son taking the curse).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes S2 (the curse) to grant S1 (the blessing) to those in ~S1 who admit their weakness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'slaughter of the innocents' and the 'curse' are treated as real and lethal.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly deconstructs moralism (the 'Virginia' story) and replaces the human subject with Christ as the one who fulfills the law.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Fight' to be seen as self-effort
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You’re never going to be any kind of Christian unless you’re willing to fight.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Matthew reads that as if it’s about Jesus... Jesus did that.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as actants of God's sovereign choice (underdogs), not as moral examples for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: God chooses them to show salvation is by grace, not strength.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'melting' of the heart rather than the burden of 'stiffening the sinews'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where the human role is to 'know they are weak'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical Herod to the 'Herod in the heart' to Christ as the 'True Son' is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'fight' of the Christian and the 'rest' of grace is resolved by the 'melting heart' motif.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He got the curse for our disobedience, so if we believe in him we get the blessing for his obedience.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied) changes the 'Vouloir' (will) by showing the beauty of Christ.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'enmity' and 'hatred' toward God's authority.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program, relegating the hearer to the Receiver position.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir in the 'Christian' application section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'fight' is always framed as a response to the 'melting'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'fight' is actually a fight to remember the Gospel.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a textbook example of a grace-oriented sermon that uses structural analysis to move from the 'what' of the text to the 'Who' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'three points' and the 'Oatmeal, Texas' joke, Greimas reveals that the joke serves to establish the 'Nazareth' actant as the 'Unexpected Helper'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Hosea 11:1; Greimas explains why Matthew's 'misreading' of Hosea is a necessary actantial shift to make Christ the Subject of Israel's story.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the '98% of people in Virginia' are actually trying to occupy the 'Subject' slot in a narrative where they are meant to be the 'Receiver'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Subject-Switch' technique perfectly, moving the burden of the Law from the hearer to Christ.
